item.title: Mr Brendan Reardon
item.description:
Mr Brendan Reardon

Brendan Reardon’s research focuses on developing algorithms for the clinical interpretation of individual patient molecular data for precision oncology.

Links

ORCID

Publications

Full list of publications see Google Scholar

Recent publications include

[1] S. H. AlDubayan, J. R. Conway, S. Y. Camp, et al. "Detection of
Pathogenic Variants With Germline Genetic Testing Using Deep Learning
vs Standard Methods in Patients With Prostate Cancer and Melanoma".
Eng. In: _JAMA_ 324.19 (Nov. 2020), pp. 1957-1969. ISSN: 1538-3598.
DOI: 10.1001/jama.2020.20457. PMID: 33201204.
[2] S. H. AlDubayan, L. C. Pyle, M. Gamulin, et al. "Association of
Inherited Pathogenic Variants in Checkpoint Kinase 2 (CHEK2) With
Susceptibility to Testicular Germ Cell Tumors". Eng. In: _JAMA
oncology_ 5.4 (Apr. 2019), pp. 514-522. ISSN: 2374-2445. DOI:
10.1001/jamaoncol.2018.6477. PMID: 30676620.
[3] J. Bellmunt, J. Kim, B. Reardon, et al. "Genomic Predictors of Good
Outcome, Recurrence, or Progression in High-Grade T1

diagnostic yield of joint genotyping-based approach for detecting rare

10.1038/s41436-020-01074-w. PMID: 33531667.
